thread.title: Rain postpones Sprint Cup race at Charlotte
thread.title_full: Rain postpones Sprint Cup race at Charlotte

title: Rain postpones Sprint Cup race at Charlotte
text:
Rain postpones Sprint Cup race at Charlotte Associated Press 8:03 p.m. EDT October 10, 2015 Equipment used for drying the track sits idle in Turn 4 after the NASCAR Sprint Cup Series auto race was postponed due to rain at Charlotte Motor Speedway in Concord, N.C., Saturday, Oct. 10, 2015. The race was rescheduled for Sunday. (AP Photo/Gerry Broome) (Photo: AP) 
CONCORD, N.C. — Heavy rain forced postponement of Saturday night’s scheduled Bank of America 500 NASCAR Sprint Cup race at Charlotte Motor Speedway. 
The race, the first in round two of the Chase for the Sprint Cup, was rescheduled for 12:30 p.m. ET Sunday and will be broadcast on NBC Sports Network. 
Rain fell in the speedway area virtually all day Saturday. 
Sunday’s forecast is greatly improved, with a predicted high of 70 and little chance of rain. 
Matt Kenseth will start Sunday’s race from the pole. He led qualifying with a speed of 194.532 miles per hour. Kyle Busch, Joey Logano, Greg Biffle and Denny Hamlin follow in the top five. 
Twelve drivers remain in the hunt for the Sprint Cup championship. Read or Share this story: http://on.flatoday.com/1Lov7hj TOP VIDEOS
